intro: Bossiaea celata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a silvery underside. It is an important nectar source for native bees and other pollinators.
